column4: Can i install any LAN driver for Windows on Linux using ndiswrapper ?
a wireless card driver you mean?
No, i've an old motherboard ( Gigabyte G31 ), it has built-in network, but i don't know how to install the drivers for it !
normal wired nic. should allready have teh drivers/modules installed.  Figure out what chipset its using. It may be you need to load the modules manually
How should i load it manually ?
theres moule autoloading files.
OK, there's another problem related to that, Now i can't install using the live cd on this mother board
i get the loading image animating and no thing happens more
try the alt-installer cd ?
and i can't use the NetInstall because the nic doesn't work ( need driver )
Can i load the modules for it from the NetInstall ?
alt-installer needs internet ?
no idea. I never do net installs
the normal desktop and alt- can both install without internet.
What does alt gives me ? min-system ?
FireCrotch,  OK, Last Q, Can i load nic modules from LiveCD or NetInstall ?
if they are included - you can load them
How to ?
if Not Included ? i should look for it ?
then you are stuck i guess
No more ways before changing mother board ?
ive never found a wired nic that wasent supported.. but there may be some out there.
Thanks for help, i tried another board ( G31 ) now, and it worked !, so i think there's a problem in the first one
Thanks anyway for info
